bibl.title: Aristophanes' Bacchylides: Reading Birds 1373-1409.
bibl.note: Argues in favour of the use of Bacchylides' Ode 5 to Hieron in Birds 1373-1409 as well as for the poem's reconfiguration by Kinesias within the context of the New Music. Comments on a number of poetic characteristics of Bacchylides' poetry and draws conclusions on Bacchylides' status within the melic tradition as the poet in-between classical lyric poetry and the New Music. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Theodora A. Hadjimichael, Aristophanes' Bacchylides: Reading Birds 1373-1409.
Greek and Roman Musical Studies 2 (2014) pp. 184-210.

Argues in favour of the use of Bacchylides' Ode 5 to Hieron in Birds 1373-1409 as well as for the poem's reconfiguration by Kinesias within the context of the New Music. Comments on a number of poetic characteristics of Bacchylides' poetry and draws conclusions on Bacchylides' status within the melic tradition as the poet in-between classical lyric poetry and the New Music. - Avec résumé en anglais.
